intro: Lepidagathis trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves with three distinct veins. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. Lepidagathis trinervis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth.
